Zack Hage
Mar 19

The Cube-Daily News Update: 3/19/17

We not only have more Sonic news today, but also headlines relating to skins and awards ceremonies. Here are your essential stories for Sunday, March 19th 2017.

The Xbox One S launches in South Africa next month:

Multiple South Africa retailers (including Raru, BC Games, and Takealot.com) have confirmed the release date for the Xbox One S in the country. It will be launching on the 13th of next month (which is a Thursday) and will cost R4999 for the 500GB model and R5999 for the 1TB model. The console originally released in August of last year in Europe and North America.

File sizes have been revealed for all versions of Mass Effect Andromeda:

Thanks to product and pre-order pages listed on the Playstation Store, we’re able to tell the file-sizes for Mass Effect Andromeda and its two other versions. The standard game will be 43.03 GBs, while Deluxe and Super Deluxe carry the same file size, 43.12GBs. Mass Effect Andromeda launches this Tuesday.

Uncharted 4 has won GOTY at SXSW’s Game Awards, among other winners:

One of the last gaming awards shows to close out the awards season, the SXSW Gaming Awards 2017 was recently held in Austin, Texas, with Uncharted 4 winning Game of the Year. The game also happened to win the most awards, with the runner up being Overwatch with four. Uncharted 4 released in May of last year.

Sonic Mania has shared it’s official artwork:

SEGA is giving plenty of fan service following the disappointing news that Sonic Mania will be delayed into the Summer, and their latest shows the game’s official box art. While it’s not completely accurate (the game doesn’t have a rating yet) this will likely be the final version upon launch. No mention if it will be reversible.

Gotham is getting its own licensed Playstation 4 controller, console skins:

Warner Bros has released five Gotham themed Playstation 4 controller and console skins, with the prices for console skins being $30, and controller skins being $15. They’re available to purchase through online retailers such as Amazon, but no plans have been made to sell them in stores. In terms of Gotham, the show’s third season aired last September.
